name: Most Time Zones
the-point: France, including its overseas territories, covers 12 different time zones.

name: The Youngest Island
the-point: Surtsey, located near Iceland, didn't exist until a volcanic eruption in 1963.

name: Lake Ocean
the-point: The Caspian Sea is technically the world's largest lake, not a sea.

name: Walking to Russia
the-point: In winter, you can technically walk from Alaska to Russia over the frozen Bering Strait.

name: No Mosquitoes
the-point: Iceland is one of the only habitable places on Earth with no native mosquitoes.

name: The Tallest Mountain
the-point: Mauna Kea is taller than Everest if measured from the base on the ocean floor.

name: Landlocked Paradox
the-point: Uzbekistan and Liechtenstein are the only 'doubly landlocked' countries in the world.

name: African Diversity
the-point: Africa is the only continent that spans all four hemispheres.

name: Driest Place
the-point: Parts of the Atacama Desert in Chile have not seen a drop of rain in recorded history.

name: City of Bridges
the-point: Hamburg, Germany, has more bridges than Venice, Amsterdam, and London combined.

name: Dead Sea Salt
the-point: The Dead Sea is nearly 10 times saltier than the ocean, making it impossible to sink.

name: Shortest Flight
the-point: The shortest commercial flight lasts only 57 seconds between Westray and Papa Westray in Scotland.

name: Monaco Size
the-point: Monaco is smaller than Central Park in New York City.

name: Antarctica Ice
the-point: Antarctica contains 90% of the world's ice and 70% of the world's fresh water.

name: Istanbul Span
the-point: Istanbul is the only city in the world located on two different continents.

name: Oldest Republic
the-point: San Marino is the world's oldest surviving republic, founded in 301 AD.

name: Lungs of Earth
the-point: The Amazon Rainforest produces about 20% of the world's oxygen.

name: Australia's Width
the-point: Australia is wider than the moon.

name: The Great Wall
the-point: Contrary to popular belief, the Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye.

name: Canadian Lakes
the-point: Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world's lakes combined.

name: Mt. Thor
the-point: Mount Thor in Canada has the world's greatest vertical drop at 4,101 feet.

name: Vatican Population
the-point: The Vatican City has a population of roughly 800 people, the smallest in the world.

name: Nile Flow
the-point: The Nile is one of the few major rivers that flows from South to North.

name: Sahara Size
the-point: The Sahara Desert is roughly the same size as the entire United States.

name: Mt. Chimborazo
the-point: Because of the Earth's bulge, the summit of Mt. Chimborazo is the closest point on Earth to the stars.
